I20040225
- create a minimal Java application Hello
- create a launch configuration for it
- select the class Hello in the package explorer
- open Export wizard and choose Macintosh application exporter
Observe:

Correction:
the problem does not occur in a new workspace, however it occurs for all launch configurations in my 
normal development workspace.

It was possible for us to pass null to the string substitution engine. Not 
sure why your main type is null, but it would be the cause of the NPE.
Fixed in AbstractJavaLaunchConfigurationDelegate. Please verify, Jared.

I don't have the code for the stack trace, but it looks like the code is just passing *all* configs to the 
Java stuff to try to find a main type. If you pass a different kind of config (say, Runtime-workbench 
or Ant), our code would blow up. It's spec'ed to return null if there's no main type defined, so this 
was just a dumb bug I introduced a couple days ago.
